title: How has swimsuit transformed over the years? - Quora

Photo: June 1943 - with my father in Grantham Swimming Pool In the 1940s when I was in a little lad my swimsuit was very like my father’s and covered me from neck to thighs. This type of swimwear had been the norm from the beginning of the 20th century.  Photo: Boston Gasworks swimming club - about 100 years ago. Nowadays, in the first quarter of the 21st century, when I go swimming I wear much briefer swimwear as do most men. Some favour shorts while I like briefs, but it seems to me there has been a significant change over the years.  Photo: 12th May 2019 - Me swimming in the pool at the Mythos Hotel, Tingaki, Kos, Greece. Am wearing my Kiniki Bluestone tanthru swim briefs.

Most transformations have been in materials & the coverage (or lack thereof). A couple of the trends I have observed with women's suits - some so-called bikinis have higher-waisted bottoms, & there are both one-piecers & two-piecers with little or no coverage over the backside. I like the lower-cut bikinis best. I have my navel pierced, & high-waisted suits rub on my piercing in ways that I don't care for. Oh, let me share a joke from when I was little! An elderly couple went to the beach for the first time in many many years. "Oh dear!" the woman said. "I need to get a new swimsuit!" "What's wrong?" her husband asked. "Mine has a big hole in the knee!"

Fashion has changed significantly since the Victorian Era, but perhaps no garment has gone through a more dramatic transformation than the swimsuit. In just over 100 years, the swimsuit has gone from long, billowing gowns to barely-there bikinis that leave little to the imagination. This drastic change is of course due to shifting mindsets about women’s rights and political freedoms. From modest to micro-mini, here is an in-depth look of history of swimwear throughout the decades.

Im no expert but swimsuits used to be really conservative for women and you can see this in a lot of old movies and shows, now we’re so body positive our swimsuits bare all and leave little to imagination. Don't get me wrong this isn't a negative thing as those who are comfortable shouldn't feel ashamed, though i wish people would also understand body positivity doesn't always mean baring all, it can just mean you feel comfortable in your own skin, and full coverage clothes as much as revealing ones :)

Men and women’s swim suit are briefer and made of better material. I remember wearing swim briefs before the 1960’s. They were made of thick outside nylon and the inside ling was all cotton. They did cover up a lot of a a man’s anatomy, yet felt nice wearing them, but took some time trying to strip it off and having a an erection in them when wet. A woman’s one piece swimsuit was about the same but with spandex material in them and fit her quite tightly. She liked wearing it, but like a man’s swim briefs of an earlier time period, would take some time and doing trying to strip it off. Today’s swimsuits for both men and women are briefer, lighter and feel much better wearing them while swimming.
From very conservative to very very sexy! Love the tiny bikinis that barely cover my goodies and the sheer when wet suits that really get attention!

Call me crazy but I would love to see the 2 piece bathing suits of the late 40’s and 50’s make a comeback. They were actually fashion statements. It’s hard to make a statement today with shoe laces and a few scraps of fabric other than “Hey look how awesome my body is, I would show more but I’ll get arrested”. When I see some of the old pinup photos I get nostalgic. Someone should take this styles and modernize them a bit. It’s not always about how much you can legally show. The suits themselves were noteworthy.
